s.text: "That clipping, Mister Kearny, that's the problem.People get very nervous around somebodywho's killed somebody--no matter why he killed them.Now maybe that's unfair, but if you thinkabout it I'm sure you'll understand it's true."
"That makes sense to you, now doesn't it?"
I'm glad.Now don't forget the paper that's due Friday."

"That clipping, Mister Kearny, that's the problem.People get very nervous around somebodywho's killed somebody--no matter why he killed them.Now maybe that's unfair, but if you thinkabout it I'm sure you'll understand it's true."

"No sir, I hit him with a bat.See, he was whipping on my mom againand whipping on me too and then one dayI just got tired of being whipped onand I hit him with my uncle's metal batand just kept hitting till he didn't move.I didn't mean to kill him, just make him stop."

"That clipping, Mister Kearny, that's the problem.People get very nervous around somebodywho's killed somebody--no matter why he killed them.Now maybe that's unfair, but if you thinkabout it I'm sure you'll understand it's true."

"No sir, I hit him with a bat.See, he was whipping on my mom againand whipping on me too and then one dayI just got tired of being whipped onand I hit him with my uncle's metal batand just kept hitting till he didn't move.I didn't mean to kill him, just make him stop."

"No sir, I hit him with a bat.See, he was whipping on my mom againand whipping on me too and then one dayI just got tired of being whipped onand I hit him with my uncle's metal batand just kept hitting till he didn't move.I didn't mean to kill him, just make him stop."

"No sir, I hit him with a bat.See, he was whipping on my mom againand whipping on me too and then one dayI just got tired of being whipped onand I hit him with my uncle's metal batand just kept hitting till he didn't move.I didn't mean to kill him, just make him stop."
His high voice trembled, his eyes were fixed on mine."
I'm glad.Now don't forget the paper that's due Friday."
I'm glad.Now don't forget the paper that's due Friday."
I'm glad.Now don't forget the paper that's due Friday."
The twin fire-doors wheezed shut behind two girls.His face deepened to a face I've cometo think of, on other faces, as ancient, accepting.

He'd pull a yellow clipping from his wallet,and while you read it he stared in your face.The other students scanned the clipping, nodded,smiled as best they could, and gave it backto the pudgy, sweaty boy, who grinned at themexpectantly.
The twin fire-doors wheezed shut behind two girls.His face deepened to a face I've cometo think of, on other faces, as ancient, accepting.
